titleStmt.title: The unfortunate Welch-man; or, The untimely death of Scotch jockey if her will fight, her cause to right, as daring to presume to kill and slay, then well her may take this to be her doom. To the tune of, The country-farmer. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guiltspur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "[...] honny-ap-Morgan to London would ride ..."
Imperfect: faded at edge with some loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
